metadata.Title: CVE-2022-46341 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A vulnerability was found in X.Org. This security flaw occurs because the handler for the XIPassiveUngrab request accesses out-of-bounds memory when invoked with a high keycode or button code. This issue can lead to local privileges elevation on systems where the X server is running privileged and remote code execution for ssh X forwarding sessions.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-46341` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

xnest - 2:21.1.5-1ubuntu1
xorg-server-source - 2:21.1.5-1ubuntu1
xserver-common - 2:21.1.5-1ubuntu1
xserver-xephyr - 2:21.1.5-1ubuntu1
xserver-xorg-core - 2:21.1.5-1ubuntu1
xserver-xorg-legacy - 2:21.1.5-1ubuntu1
xvfb - 2:21.1.5-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

xwayland - 2:22.1.6-1
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> xorg server is actually the xorg-server package the xorg package only contains docs xwayland package contains parts of xorg-server This is ZDI-CAN-19381

criterions.comment: xorg-server package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:21.1.5-1ubuntu1').
xwayland package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:22.1.6-1').
